intro: Cyrtandra valviloba, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine, silky hairs. Cyrtandra valviloba is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
